title: 3 things you should know about 2016 open enrollment
content:
DELRAY BEACH, Fla. , Sept. 30, 2015  /satPRnews.com/ — Fall is in the air, our mornings and evenings are cooling down and health insurance open enrollment is upon us. 
 
“This year’s open enrollment will be one of the most tumultuous ever, as some of the most arduous health care reform requirements kick in for employers, and insurance companies raise premiums on individuals to be more in line with their expenses,” said Jim Jalil , of HealthCareForYouNow.com D.B.A. Access Medical Health Group. 
 
Here are three things to know as you prepare for open enrollment in 2016. 
 
1. Enrollment Period 
 
This Year: 
 
2016 
 Open Enrollment Period is November 1, 2015 – January 31, 2016 . 
 
Previous years 
 
2015  
Open Enrollment Period is November 15, 2014 – February 15, 2015 . 
 
2014  
Open Enrollment Period is October 1, 2013 – March 31, 2014 . 
 
  
 
2. New Out of Pocket Limits 

 
This Year 
 
2016 
 The maximum out-of-pocket cost limit for any individual Marketplace plan for 2016 can be no more than $6,850 for an individual plan and $13,700 for a family plan 
 
Previous years 
 
2015 
The maximum out-of-pocket cost limit for any individual Marketplace plan for 2015 can be no more than $6,600 for an individual plan and $13,200 for a family plan 
 
2014 
The maximum out-of-pocket cost limit for any individual Marketplace plan for 2014 can be no more than $6,350 for an individual plan and $12,700 for a family plan
